summary: The Twenty-Third United States Census, known as Census 2010 or 2010 Census was a count of the population of the United States.
full_text: The 2010 United States Census, known as "Census 2010", is the twenty-third and most recent United States national census. National Census Day, the reference day used for the census, was April 1, 2010. As part of a drive to increase the count's accuracy, 635,000 temporary enumerators were hired. The population of the United States was counted as 308,745,538, a 9.7% increase from the 2000 Census.
title: 2010 United States Census
